definition: to walk slowly up a flight of steps (idiom)
to pick up/to collate or arrange/ten (banker's anti-fraud numeral)
to ascend in light steps
level/grade/rank/step (of stairs)/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier: step, level
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]

sentences.english: You can take the stairs or the lift up.
sentences.chinese: 你可以拾级而上或是乘坐电梯。

sentences.english: As soon as they'd pulled up, he'd leaped out of the taxi and ascended the steps past the doorman.
sentences.chinese: 因此车子一停，他就大步跨出来，经过门卫拾级而上。

sentences.english: Why I have spent half my life ascending upward.
sentences.chinese: 为什么我花了大半辈子拾级而上。

sentences.english: The a - ma temple was built by the cliff . there are winding paths around upwards the hill.
sentences.chinese: 妈阁庙依崖而建，沿山麓迂回小径，拾级而上。

sentences.english: We turn and begin the slow climb up. The old log stairs.
sentences.chinese: 我们转身，沿着陈旧的木台阶慢慢地拾级而上。

definition: stone step
to go up or down stairs step by step
alley
winding corridor/cloister/ambulatory (covered walkway around a cloister)
road or pavement laid with flagstones
stone steps
spiral stairs/winding stairs (gymnastic equipment)
flight of steps/(fig.) a means of advancement/stepping stone
halfway up a mountain/lit. waist of mountain
plank walkway constructed on the face of a cliff/(archaic) elevated passageway connecting the upper levels of adjacent towers
winding road (twisting and turning like a sheep's intestine)
steps/flight of steps/step (over obstacle)/fig. way out of an embarrassing situation/bench (geology)
promenade/long hallway/Long Corridor in the Summer Palace, Beijing 北京頤和園|北京颐和园[Bei3 jing1 Yi2 he2 yuan2]
hilltop
